title: The Silent Architect

body:
He built houses not with bricks, but with light. He studied how the morning sun hit the floorboards and how the afternoon shadows stretched across the walls. To him, a window was not just an opening, but a frame for the world outside.

People called him eccentric. He refused to use artificial lights in his designs, insisting that a home should sleep when the sun sleeps.

"We have forgotten how to be in the dark," he would say. "We have forgotten the comfort of shadows."
